citation.article-title: Haloferula rosea gen. nov., sp. nov., Haloferula harenae sp. nov., Haloferula phyci sp. nov., Haloferula helveola sp. nov. and Haloferula sargassicola sp. nov., five marine representatives of the family Verrucomicrobiaceae within the phylum 'Verrucomicrobia'.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Haloferula (Ha.lo.fe′ru.la. Gr. n. hals halos, sea; L. fem. n. ferula a stick, cane; N.L. fem. n. Haloferula, a rod-shaped bacterium from the sea).
Cells are rod-shaped, Gram-negative and obligately aerobic.
Cells lack flagella and are non-motile.
The major respiratory quinone is MK-9.
The G+C content of the genomic DNA is 63–65 mol%.
Predominant cellular fatty acid is iso-C14 : 0.
The type species is Haloferula rosea.
